sentences: Mickey Tucker (born April 28, 1941 in Durham, North Carolina) is an American jazz pianist and organist.
He performed in the 1960s with Little Anthony and the Imperials and Damita Jo, and also accompanied comedian Timmy Rogers.
He entered the jazz world in 1969, working for the next several years with Eric Kloss, Rahsaan Roland Kirk, James Moody, the Thad Jones/Mel Lewis Orchestra, Eddie Jefferson, and George Benson.
During the 1980s, he appeared on albums by Phil Woods, Art Farmer, Richie Cole, and Benny Golson.
You Leave Me Breathless (SteepleChase, 1991)With Frank Foster
1976 Battle of the Saxes (Muse)With Johnny Lytle
1997 Easy EasyWith the Art Farmer/Benny Golson Jazztet
Mean What You Say (Sonet, 1977)With Archie Shepp
1974 Live at Town Hall, Roy Brooks
The Eleventh Day of Aquarius, Ronnie Cuber
